title: Math & Numbers Fun
description: Explore the fascinating world of numbers — from fun math facts to mind-bending number trivia!

questions.question: What is the only number that is both a prime number and an even number?
questions.explanation: 2 is the only even prime number. Every other even number is divisible by 2, so they can't be prime.

questions.question: What is the value of pi (π) rounded to two decimal places?
questions.explanation: Pi (π) equals approximately 3.14159... It represents the ratio of a circle's circumference to its diameter.

questions.question: In the Fibonacci sequence (1, 1, 2, 3, 5, 8, 13...), what comes after 13?
questions.explanation: In the Fibonacci sequence, each number is the sum of the two before it. So 8 + 13 = 21.

questions.question: How many zeros are in one billion?
questions.explanation: One billion is 1,000,000,000 — a 1 followed by 9 zeros.

questions.question: What is the square root of 144?
questions.explanation: 12 × 12 = 144, so the square root of 144 is 12.

questions.question: A 'baker's dozen' refers to how many items?
questions.explanation: A baker's dozen is 13. Medieval bakers would add an extra loaf to avoid penalties for short-changing customers.

questions.question: What is the Roman numeral for 500?
questions.explanation: D represents 500 in Roman numerals. C = 100, L = 50, and M = 1,000.

questions.question: Which of these numbers is a 'perfect number' (equal to the sum of its proper divisors)?
questions.explanation: 6 is a perfect number because its divisors (1, 2, and 3) add up to 6. The next perfect number is 28.

questions.question: What is the mathematical term for a triangle with all three sides of equal length?
questions.explanation: An equilateral triangle has all three sides equal and all three angles equal (each 60°).

questions.question: If you flip a fair coin twice, what is the probability of getting heads both times?
questions.explanation: The probability is 1/2 × 1/2 = 1/4, or 25%. Each flip is independent with a 50% chance of heads.

questions.question: What is the sum of all angles inside a triangle?
questions.explanation: The angles inside any triangle always add up to exactly 180 degrees, regardless of the triangle's shape.

questions.question: How many faces does a standard cube have?
questions.explanation: A cube has 6 faces, 12 edges, and 8 vertices (corners). Each face is a perfect square.

questions.question: What is 15% of 200?
The number 'googol' — which inspired Google's name — has how many zeros?
questions.explanation: A googol is 10 to the power of 100 — a 1 followed by 100 zeros. It was named by a 9-year-old in 1920.

questions.question: What is the next prime number after 7?
questions.explanation: 11 is the next prime after 7. A prime number is only divisible by 1 and itself. 8, 9, and 10 are not prime.

questions.question: How many seconds are in one hour?
questions.explanation: One hour = 60 minutes × 60 seconds = 3,600 seconds.

questions.question: In what number system do computers fundamentally operate?
questions.explanation: Computers use binary (base 2), with only two digits: 0 and 1. Each digit is called a 'bit.'

questions.question: What mathematical concept did ancient Egyptians use to build the pyramids with perfect right angles?
questions.explanation: The Egyptians used ropes knotted in a 3-4-5 ratio to create perfect right angles, based on the Pythagorean theorem.

questions.question: What does the mathematical symbol '∞' represent?
questions.explanation: The symbol ∞ represents infinity. It was introduced by mathematician John Wallis in 1655.

questions.question: If you fold a piece of paper in half 42 times (if you could), roughly how thick would it be?
questions.explanation: Each fold doubles the thickness. After 42 folds, the paper would be about 440,000 km thick — enough to reach the Moon!
